sessions.name: Session 0.1: Audience, prerequisites, course goals, setup

content.data: This module introduces the course audience, prerequisites, learning goals, and setup instructions. It ensures all learners are ready before diving into Cloud fundamentals.

content.title: Audience üë•
content.data:
This course is designed for:
- Students in computer science or engineering
- IT professionals exploring Cloud Computing
- System administrators or DevOps beginners
- Tech enthusiasts curious about the Cloud

content.title: Prerequisites üõ†Ô∏è
content.data:
You need:
- A computer (Windows, macOS, or Linux)
- Stable internet connection üåç
- A modern browser (Chrome, Edge, Firefox)
- Git + Visual Studio Code
- A valid email (for Cloud account)

content.title: Course Goals üéì
content.data:
By the end of this 29h course, you will be able to:
- Explain Cloud fundamentals
- Differentiate between IaaS, PaaS, SaaS
- Use core Cloud services (Compute, Storage, Networking, Containers)
- Manage IAM, security, cost control
- Automate infra with Terraform
- Build & deploy a mini Cloud application with CI/CD

content.title: Setup Instructions ‚öôÔ∏è
content.data:
1. Install Git (git-scm.com)
   - Linux: sudo apt install git -y
   - macOS: brew install git
2. Install VS Code (code.visualstudio.com)
   - Extensions: YAML, Terraform, Docker, GitLens
3. Create a free Cloud account (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
4. Verify setup: run `git --version` and open VS Code.

content.title: Quick Recap üìä
content.data:
- Audience: Students & IT professionals
- Requirements: PC + Internet
- Goals: Fundamentals ‚Üí Practice ‚Üí Project
- Setup: Git + VS Code + Cloud account
